Variable Selection

Aravind Hebbali

library(blorr)
library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)

Forward Selection

Model

model <- glm(honcomp ~ female + read + science, data = hsb2,
  family = binomial(link = 'logit'))

Selection Summary

blr_step_aic_forward(model)
#> Forward Selection Method 
#> ------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Entered: 
#> 
#> - read 
#> - female 
#> - science
#> 
#>                  Selection Summary                  
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> Step    Variable       AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> 1       read         183.063    189.660     179.063 
#> 2       female       176.887    176.887     176.887 
#> 3       science      168.236    168.236     168.236 
#> ---------------------------------------------------

Detailed Output

blr_step_aic_forward(model, details = TRUE)
#> Forward Selection Method 
#> ------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 
#>  Step 0: AIC = 233.2888 
#>  honcomp ~ 1 
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> Variable     DF      AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> read          1    183.063    189.660     179.063 
#> science       1    195.777    202.373     191.777 
#> female        1    231.354    237.950     227.354 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> 
#> - read 
#> 
#> 
#>  Step 1 : AIC = 183.063 
#>  honcomp ~ read 
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> Variable     DF      AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> female        1    176.887    186.782     170.887 
#> science       1    178.710    188.605     172.710 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> - female 
#> 
#> 
#>  Step 2 : AIC = 176.8874 
#>  honcomp ~ read + female 
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> Variable     DF      AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> science       1    168.236    181.430     160.236 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> - science 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Entered: 
#> 
#> - read 
#> - female 
#> - science 
#>

#> Data Set    Resp Var    Obs.    Df. Model    Df. Residual    Convergence

#>  Parameter     DF    Estimate    Std. Error    z value    Pr(>|z|) 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)    1     -12.7772       1.9755    -6.4677      0.0000 
#>    read        1      0.1035        0.0258     4.0186       1e-04 
#>   female1      1      1.4825        0.4474     3.3139       9e-04 
#>   science      1      0.0948        0.0305     3.1129      0.0019

#> % Tied                0.0014          Tau-a            0.2794   
#> Pairs                  7791           c                0.8568

#>                  Selection Summary                  
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> Step    Variable       AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> 1       read         183.063    189.660     179.063 
#> 2       female       176.887    176.887     176.887 
#> 3       science      168.236    168.236     168.236 
#> ---------------------------------------------------

Plot

model %>%
  blr_step_aic_forward() %>%
  plot()
#> Forward Selection Method 
#> ------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Entered: 
#> 
#> - read 
#> - female 
#> - science

Backward Elimination

Model

model <- glm(honcomp ~ female + read + science + math + prog + socst, data = hsb2, family = binomial(link = 'logit'))

Selection Summary

blr_step_aic_backward(model)
#> Backward Elimination Method 
#> ---------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 4 . math 
#> 5 . prog 
#> 6 . socst 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Removed: 
#> 
#> - prog 
#> - socst
#> 
#> 
#>          Backward Elimination Summary         
#> --------------------------------------------
#> Variable        AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> --------------------------------------------
#> Full Model    162.424    188.811     146.424 
#> prog          158.953    178.743     146.953 
#> socst         157.286    173.777     147.286 
#> --------------------------------------------

Detailed Output

blr_step_aic_backward(model, details = TRUE)
#> Backward Elimination Method 
#> ---------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 4 . math 
#> 5 . prog 
#> 6 . socst 
#> 
#>  Step 0: AIC = 162.4241 
#>  honcomp ~ female + read + science + math + prog + socst 
#>

#> -------------------------------------------------

#> socst        1     160.745    183.834     146.745 
#> read         1     163.394    186.482     149.394 
#> science      1     163.815    186.903     149.815 
#> female       1     169.570    192.658     155.570 
#> math         1     170.017    193.105     156.017 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> 
#> - prog 
#> 
#> 
#>   Step 1 : AIC = 158.9527 
#>  honcomp ~ female + read + science + math + socst 
#>

#> -------------------------------------------------

#> science      1     159.941    176.432     149.941 
#> read         1     160.307    176.798     150.307 
#> female       1     166.114    182.606     156.114 
#> math         1     168.669    185.161     158.669 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> - socst 
#> 
#> 
#>   Step 2 : AIC = 157.2856 
#>  honcomp ~ female + read + science + math 
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------
#> Variable     DF      AIC        BIC      Deviance 
#> -------------------------------------------------

#> read         1     160.658    173.851     152.658 
#> female       1     164.988    178.181     156.988 
#> math         1     168.236    181.430     160.236

#> 
#> No more variables to be removed.
#>

#>

#> - Estimating concordant and discordant pairs.

#> Data Set    Resp Var    Obs.    Df. Model    Df. Residual    Convergence 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   data      honcomp     200        199           195            TRUE

#>

#> --------------------------------------------------------
#> Outcome        Frequency        Outcome        Frequency 
#> --------------------------------------------------------
#>    0              147              1              53     
#> --------------------------------------------------------
#>

#>  Parameter     DF    Estimate    Std. Error    z value    Pr(>|z|) 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)    1     -14.5773       2.1568    -6.7589      0.0000 
#>   female1      1      1.3622        0.4605     2.9580      0.0031 
#>    read        1      0.0631        0.0281     2.2455      0.0247 
#>   science      1      0.0569        0.0326     1.7429      0.0814 
#>    math        1      0.1113        0.0338     3.2992      0.0010 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>  Association of Predicted Probabilities and Observed Responses  
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------
#> % Concordant          0.8835          Somers' D        0.7669   
#> % Discordant          0.1165          Gamma            0.7669   
#> % Tied                0.0000          Tau-a            0.3003   
#> Pairs                  7791           c                0.8835   
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>

#> --------------------------------------------

#> prog          158.953    178.743     146.953 
#> socst         157.286    173.777     147.286 
#> --------------------------------------------

Plot

model %>%
  blr_step_aic_backward() %>%
  plot()
#> Backward Elimination Method 
#> ---------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . female 
#> 2 . read 
#> 3 . science 
#> 4 . math 
#> 5 . prog 
#> 6 . socst 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Removed: 
#> 
#> - prog 
#> - socst
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_path).
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_point).
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_text).

Stepwise Selection

Model

model <- glm(y ~ ., data = stepwise)

Selection Summary

blr_step_aic_both(model)
#> Stepwise Selection Method 
#> -------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1 . x1 
#> 2 . x2 
#> 3 . x3 
#> 4 . x4 
#> 5 . x5 
#> 6 . x6 
#> 
#> 
#> Variables Entered/Removed: 
#> 
#> - x6 added 
#> - x1 added 
#> - x3 added 
#> - x2 added 
#> - x6 removed 
#> - x5 added 
#> 
#> No more variables to be added or removed.
#> 
#> 
#>                       Stepwise Summary                       
#> -----------------------------------------------------------
#> Variable     Method        AIC          BIC       Deviance  
#> -----------------------------------------------------------
#> x6          addition    18869.627    18885.434    18865.627 
#> x1          addition    18571.376    18595.087    18565.376 
#> x3          addition    18016.724    18048.338    18008.724 
#> x2          addition    16642.374    16681.891    16632.374 
#> x6          removal     16640.653    16672.267    16632.653 
#> x5          addition    16639.219    16678.736    16629.219 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------

Detailed Output

blr_step_aic_both(model, details = TRUE)

Forward Selection

Model

model <- glm(honcomp ~ female + read + science, data = hsb2,
  family = binomial(link = 'logit'))

Selection Summary

blr_step_p_forward(model)
#> Forward Selection Method    
#> ---------------------------
#> 
#> Candidate Terms: 
#> 
#> 1. female1 
#> 2. read 
#> 3. science 
#> 
#> We are selecting variables based on p value...
#> 
#> Variables Entered: 
#> 
#> - read 
#> - science 
#> - female1 
#> 
#> 
#> Final Model Output 
#> ------------------
#> 
#> - Creating model overview. 
#> - Creating response profile. 
#> - Extracting maximum likelihood estimates. 
#> - Estimating concordant and discordant pairs. 
#>                              Model Overview                              
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Data Set    Resp Var    Obs.    Df. Model    Df. Residual    Convergence 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   data      honcomp     372        371           368            TRUE     
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>                     Response Summary                     
#> --------------------------------------------------------
#> Outcome        Frequency        Outcome        Frequency 
#> --------------------------------------------------------
#>    0              290              1              82     
#> --------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>                   Maximum Likelihood Estimates                    
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#>  Parameter     DF    Estimate    Std. Error    z value    Pr(>|z|)

#>    read        1      0.1000        0.0210     4.7651      0.0000 
#>   science      1      0.0798        0.0246     3.2390      0.0012 
#>   female1      1      0.9324        0.3126     2.9826      0.0029

#> % Concordant          0.8259          Somers' D        0.6607

Plot

  blr_step_p_both() %>%
  plot()
